brewery.brewery_description:
Independent, family-owned St Austell Brewery has been brewing beer in Cornwall since 1851. Fast forward 170 years and, while traditional brewing techniques remain, innovation, passion and craftsmanship continue to evolve.

Most famous for its flagship pale ale, Tribute, St Austell Brewery’s range of award-winning beers – also including Proper Job IPA and korev lager - are available in pubs and supermarkets nationwide.

St Austell Brewery also owns and operates over 180 pubs, inns, and hotels across the West Country - including managed houses and tenancies.

beer.beer_description: Cornish Best is a full-bodied, easy-drinking ale that captures the quintessential essence of life by the coast. Toffee and biscuit notes complement a hint of bitterness to deliver a well-balanced flavour that’s made all the more drinkable thanks to its low abv. Whether soaking up the seaside sun or kicking back beside the crackle of an open fire, the comforting taste of Cornish Best will have you feeling right at home. This is a moreish, sessionable ale that’s bursting with character.

items.badge_description: Thanks for staying at home, and checking in with Untappd! It allows us to stay connected to a community of beer lovers, just like you, even if we can't be in the same physical location. From our home to yours, cheers and stay safe!

Whether you’re feeling extra special or extra strong, stopping by the local pub for a delicious Extra Special / Strong Bitter or English Bitter is always a good decision! That's 35 different beers with the style of Extra Special / Strong Bitter or English Bitter. Try 5 more for Level 8!

items.checkin_comment: BBE:11/2025  Copper, white foam. Malt, grass, earthy, spice & floral aromas & flavours. Smooth body, lingering dry spice finish. Energy 259 kJ per 100ml  1 295 kJ  (£2.15 - [£2.15/4] - 500ml)

user.bio: Keen hobbyist that started the path to social media (not alcohol) 'addiction' on December 12th, 2014......  ;)

beer.beer_description: St Austell's most legendary ale, Hicks is full-bodied, strong and Cornish, brimming with a kaleidoscope of flavours. Brewed with plenty of malt and lashings of English Progress and Golding hops, Hicks is truly a classic ale of considerable depth and complexity.

Based on an original Cornish recipe Mena Dhu means black hill, named after the farm that was owned by Walter Hicks, the founder of St Austell Brewery. Mena Dhu is a new generation stout that combines the best of the old with added complexity and refreshment.

Complex and flavoursome. Deceptively light and refreshing. Subtle oak smoked aroma. Hint of dark chocolate taste. Delicate touch of liquorice on the finish.

Malts: Pale, Crystal, Chocolate, Smoked, Malted Oats, Roasted Barley
Hops: Fuggles

Big Job is a BIG beer, 7.2% alcohol, dry as a bone and jammed full of Cornish barley and as many hops as we could get our hands on. It’s not subtle, but if you love the taste of big, powerful hops Big Job will be just the Job for you!

items.badge_description: Traveling the world is hard, but not for you. It's as easy as cracking open a new brew! You have had a beer from at least 10 different regions around the world. Try 5 more for Level 3!

user.bio: Currently conducting a never ending tour of the pubs of Britain. My favourite brew is Harveys (it's in my blood).

beer.beer_description: An award-winning modern India Pale Ale, packed full of citrus, pineapple and grapefruit resinous flavours with a fine crisp bitter finish. On cask at 4.5%, bottled and canned at 5.5%, on keg at 4.5% and exported in keg at 5.5%.

items.badge_description: Your quest to quench your thirst leaves no stone unturned! That's at least That's 425 distinct venues!

There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 405 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 82!

items.badge_description: 99 bottles of beer on the wall, 99 bottles of beer. Take one down, pass it around.... That's 110 checkins with the serving style of Bottle. Try 5 more for Level 23!

beer.beer_description: Brewed with 100% British ingredients, including Maris Otter barley grown in Cornwall and East Anglia. The four UK-grown hop varieties – Target, Olicana, Jester, and Harlequin – bring the beer’s fruit-packed flavours to the fore.
The South West’s favourite beer, Tribute is an easy drinking pale ale. The zesty orange and grapefruit flavours are balanced with biscuit malt for this superb classic.

An award-winning modern India Pale Ale, packed full of citrus, pineapple and grapefruit resinous flavours with a fine crisp bitter finish. On cask at 4.5%, bottled and canned at 5.5%, on keg at 4.5% and exported in keg at 5.5%.

items.badge_description: Want to enjoy a day of brews, but need to keep your wits sharp? There are plenty of delicious brews under 5% for you to sip on throughout the day. That's 150 different beers with an ABV of 5% and lower. Try 5 more for Level 31!

beer.beer_description: Brewed with 100% British ingredients, including Maris Otter barley grown in Cornwall and East Anglia. The four UK-grown hop varieties – Target, Olicana, Jester, and Harlequin – bring the beer’s fruit-packed flavours to the fore.

items.badge_description: Fresh from the tap is one of the best ways to enjoy a beer. Just try to use a glass and not drink directly from the tap, as tempting as it may be. That's 130 checkins with the serving style of Draft. Try 5 more for Level 27!
Ahh, the trusty pale ale; crisp, refreshing, and always a good choice in a bind. That's 130 different Pale Ales or American Pale Wheats. Try 5 more for Level 27.

items.badge_description: While a pint of traditional English ale will always remain a staple, the craft beer scene in England, much like the rest of the world, has continued to grow at a rapid rate! That's 10 different beers from a brewery from England! Try 5 more for Level 3!

beer.beer_description: An award-winning modern India Pale Ale, packed full of citrus, pineapple and grapefruit resinous flavours with a fine crisp bitter finish. On cask at 4.5%, bottled and canned at 5.5%, on keg at 4.5% and exported in keg at 5.5%.
The South West’s favourite beer, Tribute is an easy drinking pale ale. The zesty orange and grapefruit flavours are balanced with biscuit malt for this superb classic.

Big Job is a BIG beer, 7.2% alcohol, dry as a bone and jammed full of Cornish barley and as many hops as we could get our hands on. It’s not subtle, but if you love the taste of big, powerful hops Big Job will be just the Job for you!

Born on Cornish shores, open horizons inspired us and nature’s elements shaped us. Pale gold like the morning sun, fresh and crisp like a coastal breeze, full-on refreshment like waves crashing against our shores: this is the coast in a glass. Drink it all in.

Cornish malts provide the perfect base to this beautifully balanced pale ale. What else would you find in a classic Nicholson’s ale but quintessentially British Fuggles and Goldings hops, along with the stunning Australian variety, Galaxy. The addition of Galaxy hops adds a whole new dimension to this fabulous brew, bringing a fruity twist to both the taste and the aroma, giving it a truly unique character.

Based on an original Cornish recipe Mena Dhu means black hill, named after the farm that was owned by Walter Hicks, the founder of St Austell Brewery. Mena Dhu is a new generation stout that combines the best of the old with added complexity and refreshment.

Complex and flavoursome. Deceptively light and refreshing. Subtle oak smoked aroma. Hint of dark chocolate taste. Delicate touch of liquorice on the finish.

Malts: Pale, Crystal, Chocolate, Smoked, Malted Oats, Roasted Barley
Hops: Fuggles

St Austell's most legendary ale, Hicks is full-bodied, strong and Cornish, brimming with a kaleidoscope of flavours. Brewed with plenty of malt and lashings of English Progress and Golding hops, Hicks is truly a classic ale of considerable depth and complexity.

Whichever way you look at it, Proper Black challenges the senses. Black as stout, but the taste is classic IPA. Powerful hops dominate the restrained chocolate and coffee notes. Whatever you thought you knew about beer, we’ve just challenged it.

Cornish Best is a full-bodied, easy-drinking ale that captures the quintessential essence of life by the coast. Toffee and biscuit notes complement a hint of bitterness to deliver a well-balanced flavour that’s made all the more drinkable thanks to its low abv. Whether soaking up the seaside sun or kicking back beside the crackle of an open fire, the comforting taste of Cornish Best will have you feeling right at home. This is a moreish, sessionable ale that’s bursting with character.
Deep bronze ale, made with Cornish Gold hops - 5.0% abv in the bottle.

Brewed with 100% British ingredients, including Maris Otter barley grown in Cornwall and East Anglia. The four UK-grown hop varieties – Target, Olicana, Jester, and Harlequin – bring the beer’s fruit-packed flavours to the fore.

Sayzon is brewed with a blend of barley, wheat and oat malts, then gently spiced with ginger, lemon and lime zest. It has a hint of cinnamon and is fermented with a special strain of ‘saison’ yeast to deliver a beer that is assertive but refreshing with a peppery spice and a refreshing citrus finish.
Smugglers is brewed with a blend of pale and dark malts and classic hops. Oak ageing and gentle spicing gives the beer a real  character and a flavour worth savouring.

Specifically brewed for the French market. Cloudy Job is a fruity and smooth New England IPA. We've combined wheat, flaked wheat, flaked oats, and most importantly, lactose, for a soft and smooth mouthfeel. Double dry hopped, including Citra, Amarillo and El Dorado. Cloudy Job is unfiltered to retain as much flavour, aroma and body as possible.

An extra-special seasonal release of a South West Favourite – a treat for all cask ale drinkers to enjoy. 

Full, rich, and fruity, Tribute Extra is an exceptionally special version of Tribute pale ale. An alluring tropical fruit aroma is met with a mouth-watering tangy marmalade flavour that overlays a smooth malt profile. At 5.2% abv, the strength sets this outstanding beer apart from its
award-winning counterpart.

Aromas of spice, yeast and banana overlay a palate of peppery hop bitterness, citrus fruit and barley sugar, followed by the warming finish that reminds the drinker this beer deserves ultimate respect.
Brewed using Malted wheat, Maris Otter and a dash of Crystal Rye malts, Baobab wheat beer is finished using a Hefeweizen top-fermenting ale yeast which lends extra banana and bubblegum flavours.
Brewed with Belgian Abbey ale yeast with dark malts, brown sugar and spiced with a gentle hand, Cardinal Syn is strong, rich and complex with modest bitterness and dark fruit and treacle aromas.

We have combined proportions of wheat, torrified wheat, flaked oats and most importantly lactose (unfermentable milk sugar), for a softer, smoother and sweeter feel. Couple the double dry-hop additions of Citra, Mosaic, El Dorado and Amarillo hops with no filtration, to produce high levels of fruit aromas and flavours. Voila we have Milkshake IPA!

First created in 2014 by our late Head Brewer, Roger Ryman, with New Riga’s Brewery in Moscow. Brewed at Christmas time each year - and matured in oak casks for a further 10 months - in 2019, Black Square fulfilled Roger’s lifelong dream of winning a gold medal at the International Brewing Awards. Whenever we brew it we can feel Roger fondly watching over us.
Rich - Smooth - Coffee
Golden and hoppy, Eden IPA is brewed using a blend of malts, including Cornish-grown Maris Otter, and aromatic hops. The beer has a fresh aroma and flavours of grapefruit and gooseberry.

Eden Pale Ale is brewed with a blend of malts, including Cornish-grown Maris Otter, and a hand picked blend of hop varieties which produce fruity, sweet and caramel flavours. An easy-drinking and flavoursome pale ale.

This English amber ale has been brewed by one of our fantastic Brewing Apprentices, Joe Baker. Joe is anything but average, however, we couldn’t resist the opportunity to give this delicious brew its tongue in cheek name. 
 
As part of their training, our Brewing Apprentices get the chance to design their very own beer and brew it in our Small Batch Brewery. Joe has made excellent use of a series of malts – Crystal, Roasted, and Oat, which are layered over Maris Otter and Cornish Gold. Traditional Fuggles and Bramling Cross hops bring a balanced and fruity bitterness, coupled with a flourish of flavour from the new English hope variety, Harlequin.

A rich an complex porter full of rich roasted malt, caramel and liquorice flavour, yet clean and light with no lingering aftertaste.
Story	

One of our recipes adapted from old volted brewing journals from around 1910.
